project.name: Daria Research of Researchers
project.description: We are researching how user researchers conduct discovery activities and plan for user research, from awareness and identifying research questions to research design, execution, analysis, and delivery.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: That sounds great. So we're going to move on to a little bit Can you tell me a little bit about how your role works today As a user researcher, do you have the tools that you need and what tools might you want?

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: That you don't have.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: I feel like I could have some more AI tools to do um synthesis and synthesis and research, better research, more accurate research, usable research instead of you know like this might or might not be right when you check it out on AI

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Because they're always like with the AI these days, there's a There's a trust but verify kind of a deal like it might not be correct. So it'd be nice if it was trustworthy.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Okay, that sounds good. So in the next, what are your vision for the next year with tools to help you do this? What do you think that you would see or what would What would you like to be added to your suite? And that's a good one as far as like hallucination validation.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: And you didn't have to verify it.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Any others?

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Um…

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: I don't know. The biggest tool that I have right now is my brain.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Okay, well, that's going to be the biggest story even in the future. So tell me a story about a user research project that you thought was going to be swimmingly and easy.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: But ended up being frustrated no matter how hard you tried, it just became a burden at every step.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Um… I would have to say Eli Lilly.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Just because… I have a specific method of you know doing workshops and gathering data And it generally works great, but the people on your team have to be on board with it.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Yeah, Graybar. Great Bar Electric.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: That one went swimmingly well. Everybody understood my methods. They did the work that I asked them to. We came up with some really great wireframes for the employee portal and an excellent recommendation for the team.

entries.text: We were chosen to be chosen explore options of a very customized, personalized employee portal.

entries.text: Put all of those down on cards, every single piece of functionality that it could do.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: And then thought of thought workshopped with tara on extra things that it couldn't do that could be customized.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: And then created a huge card sort activity and interviewed 20 of their employees through the card sort And then prioritize the cards as an order of priority of what would help them through their workday.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: And that's basically what we did for The activity that we did for that. We only have one month to do this project. So it was very short and quick.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: It was me and those me her and we did a great job And that particular activity would agree.

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Now, do you have a list of ask when you start for the part where you want to kind of do background How do you organize your requests or how long does it take to kind of put together what you're needing and how much time do you spend on kind of gathering and analyzing

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Whatever you receive from the client.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: It depends on how big my team is and if I have to do it by myself, of course, it takes longer. But if you have a team, you can delegate and things go quicker. But I generally fast track everything as much as possible.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: And try to utilize the team and delegate to where towards people's strengths. If somebody is particularly fond of design, I will let them do that and I will do more of the grant work if they like doing the interviews, I will let them do that.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: Do the stuff that they don't like to do from a leadership perspective i always pick the stuff that my team doesn't like to do because I can actually do all of it, right?

entries.speaker: Dulaney, Stephen
entries.text: Okay.

entries.speaker: Ballew, Suzette
entries.text: That's how I expedite projects.
